title: Requires a condemnor to compensate home owners for loss in value due to a diminished viewshed
summary: Requires a condemnor to compensate home owners for loss in value due to a diminished viewshed.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2790

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  CROUCH,  HAWLEY,  McDONOUGH, FINCH, CALHOUN,
         DUPREY, THIELE -- read once and referred to the Committee on Judiciary

       AN ACT to amend the eminent domain procedure law, in relation to requir-
         ing homeowners to be compensated for reduction in the value  of  their
         home due to a diminished viewshed

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The eminent domain procedure law is amended by adding a new
    2  section 306 to read as follows:
    3    S 306. OFFERS FOR DIMINISHED VIEWSHED. (A) WHENEVER A  PUBLIC  PROJECT
    4  IS  ESTABLISHED  WITHIN ONE THOUSAND FEET OF A RESIDENTIAL DWELLING, THE
    5  CONDEMNOR SHALL INVESTIGATE ANY POTENTIAL LOSS IN  VALUE  OF  SUCH  REAL
    6  PROPERTY DUE TO A DIMINISHED VIEWSHED RESULTING FROM THE PUBLIC PROJECT.
    7  IF  IT  IS DETERMINED THAT THERE IS A LOSS IN VALUE OF SUCH PROPERTY DUE
    8  TO THE DIMINISHED VIEWSHED, THE CONDEMNOR SHALL COMPENSATE THE OWNER  OF
    9  SUCH PROPERTY WITH THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF THE LOSS.
   10    (B)  ALL  OFFERS  MADE  AND  NEGOTIATIONS  UNDERTAKEN PURSUANT TO THIS
   11  SECTION SHALL BE SUBJECT TO THE SAME PROVISIONS AS  ALL  OTHER  ACQUISI-
   12  TIONS  PURSUANT  TO  THIS  CHAPTER.  A PERSON WHOSE PROPERTY IS AFFECTED
   13  UNDER THIS SECTION IS ENTITLED TO THE SAME  PROCEDURES  FOR  DETERMINING
   14  JUST COMPENSATION UNDER ARTICLE FIVE OF THIS CHAPTER.
   15    S  2.  This  act  shall take effect immediately and shall apply to any
   16  public project that has not been completed as of such effective date.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04544-01-1
